summary: The "Close the Medigap Act of 2025" amends Title XVIII of the Social Security Act to reform Medicare supplemental health insurance policies. Key provisions include: guaranteeing issue of policies without discrimination based on health status or genetic information; establishing medical loss ratio requirements; setting new standards relating to pricing discrimination (age, eligibility for low-income programs, and geographic limitations); enhancing the Medicare Plan Finder website; restoring access to first-dollar Medigap coverage; and requiring transparency from Medigap insurance brokers regarding payments to agents and brokers. The bill aims to protect consumers and improve access to Medicare supplemental plans.
